page.title: 06GAMES PLAYED IN ST TEATH
page.content: GAMES PLAYED {AT SCHOOL}IN LESSONS ARE FOOTBALL, ROUNDERS, NETBALL AND "COMMANDO" CRICKET. IN THE {PLAYGROUND GAMES LIKE SKIPPING, TIG, COWBOYS AND INDIANS, MR WOLF, HOP-SCOTCH, FARMERS IN THE DEN ARE PLAYED. {AT HOME,}PEOPLE PLAY OUT ON THEIR BIKES OR BOARD GAMES LIKE MONOPOLY, SCRABBLE, LUDO OR CARD GAMES SUCH AS SNAP OR WHIST.ANOTHER INSIDE GAME IS TIDDLYWINKS - EACH PERSON HAS, SAY TEN TIDDLYWINKS,WHICH ARE SMALL THIN PLASTIC CIRCLES. THEY HAVE A POT ON THE TABLE AND THEY TAKE IT IN TURN TO TRY AND FLICK THEIR TIDDLYWINKS INTO THE POT. THE{YOUNGER CHILDREN}PREFER NOISY CHASING GAMES SUCH AS ROBIN HOOD AND KISS-CHASE. IN QUIETER MOMENTS THEY PLAY MUMMIES AND DADDIES. THEY LIKE PLAYING HIDE AND SEEK AND A FEW SINGING GAMES LIKE THE BIG SHIP SAILS.
